III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Heart for Home is located in Kalamazoo, Michigan. The agency occupies one half
of a building that is shared with another non-profit organization. A lobby separates
the two organizations; however, there are shared spaces, such as a conference
room, kitchen, and storage area. Heart for Home leadership have developed
procedures to ensure confidentiality and privacy for the families and youth they
serve. The agency office has individual office space for each staff member with
furniture and equipment needed to perform the functions of foster home
certification. The office also includes separate meeting/visitation rooms with doors
that can be closed for privacy and confidentiality. The office contains lockable file
cabinets as well as a cross-shredder for storage and destruction of CHRI, as
needed.
B. Program Description
Heart for Home certifies foster homes for the purpose of providing respite to
foster, adoptive, and kinship families within Allegan, Barry, Berrien, Calhoun,
Cass, Kalamazoo, Ottawa, St. Joseph, and Van Buren counties. The respite
homes with provide care for youths aged zero to eighteen of all characteristics.
Heart for Home will also offer support before, during, and after respite care
through training and relationship development.
Heart for Home is contracted with MDHHS to provide Foster Care Respite
Services for a term of 2 years and 4 months beginning March of 2024 with up to
two, one-year renewal options. The contractor requires Heart for Home to be a
licensed Child Placing Agency.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is found to be in full compliance.
